title: Set up the report in the Microsoft Word plug-in and upload it in Creatio
content_markdown:
Version: 8.2All Creatio products
On this page
After you [install the Microsoft Word plug-in](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=1412) and [create a report](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=1413) in Creatio, you can start setting up the report layout. You can customize the layout by editing the standard Microsoft Word template.
Setup of Microsoft Word report template includes the following general steps:
1. **Download and edit the template** in the Creatio Microsoft Word plug-in. Read more >>>
2. **Modify the ready template** in the Creatio Microsoft Word plug-in if needed. Read more >>>
3. **Upload the updated template file** to Creatio. Read more >>>
You can also use macros to set up reports. Learn more: [Customize Microsoft Word reports](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=15701&anchor=title-1372-1).
## Download and edit the template in the Creatio Microsoft Word plug-in​
1. **Open** an empty Microsoft Word document on your computer.
2. **Click** **Connect** on the Creatio plug-in toolbar.
3. **Log in to Creatio** using your credentials (Fig. 1).
Fig. 1 Connect the plug-in and log in
![Fig. 1 Connect the plug-in and log in](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/sites/academy_en/files/images/NoCode_Customization/set_up_the_report_in_the_microsoft_word_plug-in/scr_log_in_with_plugin.png)
4. **Select the needed report** from the list by clicking **Select report**.
As a result, a list of columns for the selected report will be displayed on the right of the Microsoft Word window.
### Add fields to the template​
In the template, the report fields are represented as the Microsoft Word fields. When the report is generated, the field will contain data from the corresponding Creatio record. The list of available fields is displayed in the **Word report data** window (Fig. 2).
#### Add all fields to the template​
To add all the fields [configured in the Report Designer](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=1413&anchor=HT_cases_print_forms_setup_word_add_fields) to a template, drag a group of fields to the template page (Fig. 2).
Fig. 2 Add a field group to a template
![Fig. 2 Add a field group to a template](https://academy.creatio.com/guides/sites/en/files/documentation/user/en/print_ready_reports/BPMonlineHelp/print-ready_reports_edit_and_upload/scr_cases_print_forms_setup_word_template_add_all.png)
As a result, all fields and names of the corresponding Creatio columns will be added to the template (Fig. 3).
Fig. 3 Report template that contains a field group
![Fig. 3 Report template that contains a field group](https://academy.creatio.com/guides/sites/en/files/documentation/user/en/print_ready_reports/BPMonlineHelp/print-ready_reports_edit_and_upload/scr_cases_print_forms_setup_word_template_view_all.png)
You can use standard Microsoft Word tools to customize the added fields.
#### Add separate fields to the template​
1. **Drag the corresponding field** to the page to add data to the template (Fig. 4). When the report is generated, the field will contain data from the corresponding Creatio record.
Fig. 4 Add a field to the report template
![Fig. 4 Add a field to the report template](https://academy.creatio.com/guides/sites/en/files/documentation/user/en/print_ready_reports/BPMonlineHelp/print-ready_reports_edit_and_upload/scr_cases_print_forms_setup_word_template_add_one_field.png)
2. **Add all other necessary fields** as well as the text to the report (Fig. 5).
Fig. 5 Report that has the added fields and static text
![Fig. 5 Report that has the added fields and static text](https://academy.creatio.com/guides/sites/en/files/documentation/user/en/print_ready_reports/BPMonlineHelp/print-ready_reports_edit_and_upload/scr_cases_print_forms_setup_word_template_view_added.png)
3. **Save the report template**.
### Add table data to a template​
Add all table columns to the template
To add all the table columns [configured in the Report Designer](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=1413&anchor=HT_cases_print_forms_setup_word_add_fields) to a template, drag a group of fields to the template page (Fig. 6).
Fig. 6 Add all table columns to the template
![Fig. 6 Add all table columns to the template](https://academy.creatio.com/guides/sites/en/files/documentation/user/en/print_ready_reports/BPMonlineHelp/print-ready_reports_edit_and_upload/scr_cases_print_forms_setup_word_template_add_all_tbl.png)
As a result, the template will contain the table that has all columns from the selected group. Titles of table columns will correspond to the titles of columns in Creatio.
You can use standard Microsoft Word tools to customize the added table. The text in titles of the table columns can be edited. Fields placed in table cells determine data that will be displayed in the column.
#### Add separate columns​
1. **Add a simple table** that contains the required number of columns to the template page. Each column must comprise a title and one row (Fig. 7).
Fig. 7 Add a table to the template manually
![Fig. 7 Add a table to the template manually](https://academy.creatio.com/guides/sites/en/files/documentation/user/en/print_ready_reports/BPMonlineHelp/print-ready_reports_edit_and_upload/scr_cases_print_forms_setup_word_template_view_tbl_2.png)
2. **Enter the text** of the column titles (Fig. 8).
Fig. 8 Table that has static titles of columns
![Fig. 8 Table that has static titles of columns](https://academy.creatio.com/guides/sites/en/files/documentation/user/en/print_ready_reports/BPMonlineHelp/print-ready_reports_edit_and_upload/scr_cases_print_forms_setup_word_template_view_tbl_3.png)
3. **Drag a column title** to an empty cell of the table that must display data from this column (Fig. 9).
Fig. 9 Table that has fields added
![Fig. 9 Table that has fields added](https://academy.creatio.com/guides/sites/en/files/documentation/user/en/print_ready_reports/BPMonlineHelp/print-ready_reports_edit_and_upload/scr_cases_print_forms_setup_word_template_view_tbl_1.png)
4. **Set up the template visual appearance** by placing the table in the right part of the file (Fig. 10).
Fig. 10 Set up a template visual appearance
![Fig. 10 Set up a template visual appearance](https://academy.creatio.com/guides/sites/en/files/documentation/user/en/print_ready_reports/BPMonlineHelp/print-ready_reports_edit_and_upload/scr_cases_print_forms_setup_word_template_view_rezult.png)
5. **Save the report template**.
As a result, the fields of the table will contain data from Creatio in the generated report. The number of rows in the table will correspond to the number of records.
## Edit the existing template in the Creatio Microsoft Word plug-in​
You can modify the layout of any Microsoft Word report in Creatio at any time.
1. **Open** an empty Microsoft Word document on your computer.
2. **Click** **Connect** on the Creatio plug-in toolbar.
3. **Log in to Creatio** using your credentials.
4. **Click** **Select report** on the **Creatio** tab of the Microsoft Word ribbon.
This opens the list of available Microsoft Word reports.
5. **Select a report** to configure and click **OK**. This opens the current report template.
6. **Click** **OK** in the pop-up window. This opens the previously configured template file.
7. **Make the necessary changes** to the template layout.
8. **Click** **Save to Creatio** on the **Creatio** tab of the Microsoft Word ribbon.
As a result, the plug-in will upload your report template to Creatio.
## Upload the updated template to Creatio​
To add the edited template in Creatio:
1. **Open** an empty Microsoft Word document on your computer.
2. **Click** **Connect** on the Creatio plug-in toolbar.
3. **Log in to Creatio** using your credentials.
4. **Click** **Save in Creatio**.
5. **Click** **Save**.
As a result, a new template will be used the next time this report is generated.
You can also upload the report in the Report Designer directly by clicking **Upload template**.
* * *
## See also​
[Install Creatio plug-in for Microsoft Word](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=1412)
[Add a new Microsoft Word report in Creatio](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=1413)
